comments:
Hi

I try to build aTrack project that I downloaded from http://atrack.dev.java.net 
and found that ANT failed on Eclipse but have have no problem with command line 
build.

I've seen the bug reported against 1.1 rc2 but looks like it still exist in 
AspectJ 1.1.1, below are information from Eclipse 2.1.2 IDE and my execution 
result for your rference, hopefully it can help to identify to problem.

Thanks a lot.

# Eclipse 2.1.2 Preference shows
AspectJ Compiler version: 1.1.1
AspectJ Plugin version: 0.6.4

# Eclipse ANT version: 1.5.3

=============================================
= my build properties file (build.properties)
=============================================
aspectj.home=E:/Tools/aspectj1.1
deploy.dir=E:/Tomcat5.0/webapps

========================
= build from DOS prompt
========================
F:\cvsroot\atrack\atrack>ant -propertyfile F:\Codes\aTrack\build.properties 
ajee.jar
Buildfile: build.xml

__checkEnvProperty:

__checkEnvProperty:

    [mkdir] Created dir: F:\cvsroot\atrack\atrack\dist
    [mkdir] Created dir: F:\cvsroot\atrack\atrack\build\reports

[iajc - zip] Building zip: F:\cvsroot\atrack\atrack\build\ajee.jar

BUILD SUCCESSFUL

ATrack is built regularly using iajc, so this is probably bug 34246.  Try
forking, and if that works, please close this as a duplicate of 34246.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 34246 ***
